file_content.text: Once this place is flaming rubble, that Star Fortress will be wide-open to attack.
The enemy doesn't know what hit them. My recruits are as good as I thought.
I'll get my recruits into position and meet you inside the shield generator bunker.
You did it, Commander! That's everything we need to start this shield-busting party.
We're not fully supplied yet. What can I do for you, Commander?
I swear, I think I felt the ruckus you kicked up at that shield generator all the way over here.
Scout out that shield generator and let me know what you find.
Commander! Good to meet you! K'krohl's the name, talent scouting's my game. Your Alliance pays me to track and evaluate escaped prisoners.
Don't mind me. I got a legal permit to be on Belsavis.
Scratch one Star Fortress! I wish I could've been there to see it. I'm not missing out on anything else.
You just missed a party, Commander! A bunch of my Belsavis recruits stopped by to celebrate you taking down that Star Fortress.
They made you a card and everything. It's around here somewhere. The point is, everything's turned out great for us.
From now on, Bitsy and me are only a holocall away. Looking forward to our next mission, Commander.
That Star Fortress over Belsavis is unshielded. If we're taking it out of the sky, now's the time.
I've already negotiated a salary fighting for you full-time--but not until this business is over. Let's get it done, Commander.
Knocking down that Star Fortress won't be easy, but if anyone can do it, it's you.
You're as good as they say--maybe better! Everyone on that Star Fortress knows they lost their shield. That's gotta be scary for them.
I know you're not a fan of my job here, but you have to admit--my recruits helped.
Our losses were surprisingly light. I've got quite a few ex-cons thinking they're getting off this rock to help the Alliance.
But my new job is coordinating the Star Fortress attacks from your camp on Odessen. What should I do with my recruits before I ship out?
Leave the prisoners here. They can't be trusted.
I'll send them to an isolated rendezvous. By the time they figure out I'm not coming, it'll be too late.
Bring them along. The Alliance is a second chance for anyone willing to serve.
That's what I've been telling them. I'm glad to hear it coming from you.
We'll take them with us. They'll get the most suicidal missions I can find.
I'll just tell them we're honoring our deal. They'll figure out the rest on their own.
Do what you think is best. You know them better than me.
They followed orders and behaved themselves. I think they're worth keeping around.
And if they ever do step out of line, I still have Bitsy. Thanks for trusting my judgment.
Maybe when that Star Fortress is a big pile of space garbage, I'll get out of the recruiting business. I'd like that.
Knocking out that shield generator was the most fun I've had in years. I wouldn't mind signing-on with you full time.
But that Star Fortress has gotta go, first. I'll see you on Odessen, Commander.
I know where to plant the detonite so it'll bring this whole place down. Looking forward to seeing you in action, Commander. Let's go!
We've got troops, gear, and a clear shot at the generator bunker. I'll meet you inside.
Don't start without me.
I wouldn't dream of it, Commander.
I didn't think you'd join the fighting.
I've been on the sidelines for too long--and Bitsy needs to go for a walk.
Your recruits are expendable. Understood?
I'll cut their leashes. What happens after that is their problem, am I right?
Keep your fingers crossed I still have an eye for talent. Let's move out.
[Turn in supply crates.]
What a find! This gear looks new--and no bloodstains!
[Report the Belsavis Resistance Campaign is complete to receive a massive Influence gain.]
Hey, that's great news! A lot of those bad things you stomped were hassling my recruits. Good riddance.
This is getting us closer, but we're not there yet.
I'll keep looking for more supplies.
I'll keep my recruits from deserting while you're gone. It's a full time job.
[Start the Belsavis Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
[Start a Heroic Mission to secure supply crates.]
One of my recruits gave me a lead on where you could get some supplies. It's worth a try.
[Start an Eternal Empire Champion Duel.]
I'm hearing rumors that say Zakuul is sending its heavy-hitters to stir things up. That's trouble we don't need.
On the other hand, I bet you anything their people are well-supplied. Two birds with one stone, am I right?
Once we've got everything we need, we'll take down that shield generator.
Should've figured that bunker would have external defenses. Glad you took them out, Commander.
Now for the real tricky part--getting enough detonite inside that place to burn it down for good.
I can provide warm bodies for the assault, but they'll need outfitting. I hate to put it on you, but supplying troops ain't exactly my specialty.
There must be some way to get what we need.
I'm not a delivery service--and your "warm bodies" are disposable scum.
Not so loud! You never know who's listening.
For the record, I agree with you--but we'll lose our recruits if we don't at least pretend to care they'll survive.
There's all kinds of emergencies on Belsavis. People in need tend to be grateful when you help them out. And hey, there's always looters to steal from, am I right?
I'll let you know once we've got enough supplies to mount the assault. Good luck, Commander.
If I think someone's worth recruiting to fight the Eternal Empire, I make them an offer. If they refuse, I introduce them to "Bitsy."
Fun work. Never a dull moment. But that Star Fortress is making all kinds of trouble. We need it gone.
No one told me the Alliance is recruiting escaped prisoners.
Lana Beniko hired me to identify anyone I think can be "rehabilitated" and send them to the fight.
Some of these folks ain't all bad. I mean, sure, they've killed a few people--but who here hasn't, am I right?
These prisoners can't be rehabilitated. That's why they're on Belsavis. I'm shutting down your recruitment drive.
But I just bought a house! Oh, well... I didn't pay much. It's a buyer's market.
The thing is, we still have to do something about that Star Fortress before we go.
How do you evaluate prisoners for rehabilitation?
If they attack on sight, that's a meaningful predictor of future behavior.
Not too many get past that stage of the screening process. But I'm an optimist. I keep trying.
My job would be a lot easier if that Star Fortress wasn't stirring up the crazy down here.
I see the potential in gathering some disposable cannon fodder. How many recruits have you found?
Eh, not enough. Most of my negotiations end with Bitsy. I blame that blasted Star Fortress.
What is a Star Fortress doing above Belsavis? Why is it here?
It ain't to keep law and order, that's for sure.
You mentioned someone named "Bitsy." Who is that?
Bitsy's my top-of-the-line Czerka military assault cannon! When negotiations turn sour, Bitsy takes over. Real conversation-stopper.
I've been needing Bitsy a lot lately, and I think it's on account of that Star Fortress.
At first, I couldn't figure why Zakuul would set up a fancy battle station over Belsavis. Seems like overkill, y'know?
But then I started seeing Zakuul shuttles flying down to the lowest vaults, where the worst prisoners are locked-up.
They're releasing them to run riot up here. I'm starting to think Zakuul had the same bright idea as the Alliance. Maybe they're on their own recruitment drive?
That's a disaster in the making. The worst threats the galaxy has ever faced are imprisoned down there. They can't be controlled--not even by Zakuul.
Sooner or later, one of these lunatics is gonna find a way off Belsavis.
If Zakuul is recruiting, that's good news. It means they're getting scared of us--and desperate.
The trouble is, I can't recruit the crazy ones--and they're killing my prospects.
If we take down that battle station, the enemy won't have a base of operations to keep up this nonsense.
We're taking down that Star Fortress. Where do we start?
The first thing to do is hit the shield generator protecting the Star Fortress. I've got coordinates, but no strategy. That's where you come in, Commander.
Take a look at that shield generator and see what we're up against. In the meantime, I'll gather some recruits and rendezvous back here.
[Start the Belsavis Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
Can you believe the Republic and the Sith Empire are still going at it over this place? Just crazy, am I right?
Between you and me, some of my better prospects are deserters from those armies. If you settled the score here, they'd be free to sign up.
From now on, Bitsy and me are only a holocall away. Looking forward to our next mission, Commander.
[Turn in Alien Research crate.]
[Turn in Ancient Artifact crate.]
[Turn in Military Equipment crate.]
[Turn in Smuggled Goods crate.]
[Go Back.]
[Do Nothing.]
I'm working on some new recruits from the Outer Rim. They're rusty, but they'll polish up in time.
Bitsy's getting anxious with all this waiting. What do you say we take her out for a spin, Commander?
Fun group you've got here. Plenty of scars to keep the stories interesting.
We're snatching the best recruits from the galaxy's underbelly and leaving Zakuul with the damages.
Need someone "enlisted?"
Recruitment is on the rise. People put their history aside to stand with you, Commander.
Let's go rattle some heads. To the right cause, that is.
Anyone need some extra motivation? Bitsy's happy to play the "negotiator."
